summary: Marlin Risinger III was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears on payroll certifications for the months of February, November, and December of 1977. The documents list his name and salary, confirming his employment with the committee during that period.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Marlin Risinger III's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, indicating his involvement in the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination, although the specific nature and extent of his role are not detailed in the provided documents.
